CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - award;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She is also a paraplegic .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a property - related claim with ORG ( PERSON ) in GPE , seeking declaratory relief . In so doing , she failed to specify the exact value of the claim in question ( vrijednost spora ) . However , on DATE she paid court fees of MONEY ( ORG ) , which corresponded to the value of claims ranging between ORG CARDINAL and EUR CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE , at the end of the main hearing ( glavna rasprava ) and after additional evidence had been examined , the applicant specified that the value of the claim was EUR CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ruled in favour of the applicant . The judgment stated , inter alia , that the value of the claim was LAW and noted that “ [ an expert witness had assessed that ] on CARDINAL DATE ... the total value of ... the property ... [ at issue had been ] ... LAW ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) in GPE quashed that judgment and ordered a re - trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , after the main hearing had ended and on the court 's request , specified that the value of the claim was EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL . On DATE the respondent 's representative submitted his claim for costs based on the value of the claim being ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ruled against the applicant . The judgment specified , inter alia , that the value of the claim was LAW and once again referred to the said expert 's findings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment on appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) in GPE rejected the applicant 's appeal on points of law ( revizija ) as inadmissible , stating that the court fees ( sudska taksa ) paid by the applicant had indirectly set the value of the claim significantly below the statutory threshold ( see LAW at paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . Sections CARDINAL provide general rules as regards the means of establishing the value of a civil claim .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that in cases not relating to pecuniary requests the relevant value of the claim shall be the CARDINAL indicated by the plaintiff in his / her claim .

CARDINAL . Section QUANTITY further provides that when the value specified by the plaintiff appears to be obviously incorrect , the competent first - instance court shall “ at the latest at the preliminary hearing ( pripremno ročište ) or , if there was no preliminary hearing , at the main hearing before the examination of merits , speedily and in an adequate manner , check the accuracy ” of the specified value .

CARDINAL . LAW provides that when the right to an appeal on points of law depends on the value of the claim “ the plaintiff has a duty to indicate [ the value of the claim ] in the statement of claim ” .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that an appeal on points of law shall not be admissible in non - pecuniary matters where the value of the claim does not exceed approximately EUR CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . Under sections ORG and CARDINAL - CARDINAL , inter alia , ORG may , should it accept an appeal on points of law lodged by one of the parties concerned , overturn the impugned judgment or quash it and order a re - trial before the lower courts .
CARDINAL . Sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of this LAW stipulate that legal guardianship shall be provided only to persons not capable of taking care of their “ person , rights and interests ” .
